Reviews.Title: Best tablet out there for $149!
Reviews.Author: derekmski
Reviews.Content: This is a really great tablet.  I got it for $149 so I didn't have my hopes too high with it being this cheap but it's an excellent tablet.  I would say this is by far the best tablet for $149.  The build quality seems to be really good, not cheap and creaky like the Hisense Sero 7 Pro from Walmart.  The back is mildy grippy like the nexus 7.  It's super light only weighing 314g!  It has front and rear cameras that aren't that great but it's better than nothing.  The tablet comes with Android 4.2.2 and it's stock Android with only 2 Dell cloud apps that can be disabled anyways so it's nice and clean.  Dell says it'll get 4.4 KitKit soon.  This does have a GPS, and an ambient light sensor for automatic brightness.  The micro sd slot works well, I have a 32GB card in it working great.  The speaker is on the bottom side to when laying flat the sound isn't muffled, it gets really loud for a little speaker.  The sound quality when you plug headphones in is excellent, blew me a way, the sound is full and rich if you're listening to a good source.  The screen is very bright and sharp, good viewing angles because it's an IPS display. This plays a bunch of high end games without a hitch.  Battery life seems to be pretty good, they claim up to 10 hours.  Comes with a nice 10W power adapter and a micro usb cable.UPDATE 11/15/2013:I'm still liking this tablet overall but I noticed a thing after using it for awhile.  The automatic brightness level at night or in a darker room is way too bright, it's very hard on the eyes and I have to manually turn the brightness down because it's so bright at night.  I have contacted Dell about this and they have forwarded it to the department that handles the software on this tablet so hopefully it's adjusted in a future update.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Dirk
Reviews.Content: I just got this tablet so I can't speak to longevity, etc., but as for first impressions, this is a really great tablet for the price.  What I like:-Build quality seems excellent - really solid feel.-Micro SD slot for expansion is great.-Pretty much stock Android (I have used the Samsung version in the past, I found it almost unworkable).-Lots of RAM and a fairly fast processor means apps run quicklyOn the negative side, it has cameras, though they are pretty low quality - good enough for Skype, etc., but won't beat your phone for pictures.Overall, I would recommend.  I will update after a while if anything goes wrong.EDIT 11/7/2013: Just thought I would give an update about the Micro SD card reader, as I was a bit confused about it.  On the Dell site, it says it is SDXC compatible, supporting up to 128GB (when they are available), but in other spots it says "a micro SD slot for up to 32GB of additional storage", which would imply it is not SDXC compatible.  Well, tonight I put in a 64GB SDXC card, formatted to FAT32, and all 64GB were available.  Copied files from my desktop onto the card, and the Venue was able to read them no problem.  So that is a very nice feature if you have a lot of movies, music, etc you want to lug around with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Value For The Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Seven inches seems to be the "sweet spot" in size for a tablet that is convenient to carry around and yet large enough to actually use, so I ordered this one to see if it works for me. I find this tablet to be very well designed, with good screen viewing angles and adequate battery life, but to have limited internal speakers.Design:The tablet is very comfortable to hold and quite compact. The device is designed for portrait mode (the camera is at the top when held that way), although it works fine in landscape, which is my preferred mode. The top has the power button and jack for a standard headset. The left side has volume +/- and the MicroUSB port. The bottom has the speakers in the middle, and the Dell asset tag. The right side has a compartment that opens to reveal the MicroSD card slot and a slot for a MicroSIM card (which is filled in for my WiFi model). The rear is smooth but not slippery.Use:The device is quite snappy in use, and never got hot even when running benchmarks or movies. The interface is pretty basic, but easy to use, unlike other vendors who put too much stuff on top of Android. I was able to open a lot of programs and switch back and forth between them easily; multitasking is quite good. I was concerned about the Intel Atom based tablet being fast enough, but this one does well (benchmarks below). HTML 5 and YouTube movies worked well and looked fine, but it will not support flash (see below). The screen is not the highest resolution (that would be the Nexus 7 in the Android community), but it is very clear, and will support HD. It can be seen even in bright sunlight, although I think it is really best indoors - it was readable in sunlight but not absolutely bright. The device includes the Android browser and Chrome, plus a minimal suite of included software, mostly Google products such as Mail and Calendar. Overall, I am pleased with the user experience.Good:+ Capable of 4G operation when ordered that way. Mine is the WiFi only model.+ Support for a Micro SD card. I didn't test this because in my particular use I don't need that much storage. The box and Amazon page say it will support up to 64Gb, but the Dell web site says it will support 128Gb SDXC as well.+ Very good screen angles, left, right, up, down. The resolution is not the highest, but it plays HD videos very well.+ Battery life is about 8 hours of normal browsing at average screen brightness. I was able to browse for a couple of hours and then watch two full movies before it got below 30%. This was indoors; battery life will be different if the screen is turned all the way up, or automatically goes to maximum when used outside. Nevertheless I think for the size of the device it is good.+ Performance is good, but not maximum. The device uses the Intel Atom (Z2560) chip running at 1.6 Ghz (the Amazon site says 2 Ghz). I was interested to discover that it is actually a dual core chip running with hyper-threading, rather than actually having 4 physical cores. It rendered a Quadrant benchmark score of 6102. As a comparison, my Snapdragon powered HTC One (also 1.6 Ghz, but four physical cores) achieved 9120 on the same test. However it feels fine in use, and because of the 2Gb of RAM (many tablets still use 1GB), multitasking was great.+ There is not a lot of "bloatware" on the tablet - it installed pretty "clean".+ There is a low resolution front camera for use when video conferencing.+ Charging is via a standard MicroUSB, which is good, because in the past Dell has opted for non-standard chargers.Not-So-Good:- The tablet will not display flash content. This means that one cannot watch Amazon streaming movies, or most web cam type shows. I was simply unable to get the Adobe flash player working on this model. It comes with Android 4.2.2, which does not include Flash.  There is a work around that I have used before (download Flash from the Adobe website), but that did not work; I finally gave up on trying to get Flash to show up. I subsequently tried it on my HTC One, which is running 4.3, and it doesn't work there either, so I did not detract any stars. The tablet will display HTML5 just fine.- The screen really picks up fingerprints. I didn't detract for this either, but it will get marked up!- There is only a single speaker, at the bottom of the device, so there is no stereo output. Sound is not really that good unless one is using headphones; it is strong but not that clear.- The device comes with Pocket Cloud software. In theory, this allows one to access the desktop from the tablet. The Companion software is available for PC or Mac. When I attempted to use it my antivirus warned that there was an attack on a security hole, so I uninstalled it and did not go any further. I'm not sure what the software was attempting, but I won't accept any security risk.- The main camera is a bit small - only 3 megapixels. Considering that a tablet this small really is designed to carry around, I would have hoped for an 8 Megapixel at least.- My device has a slight defect. When the screen is held landscape and tilted so that one is looking down at the device, there is a strip of orange showing for about 1/3 the length of the screen, across the bottom. It is obviously some kind of manufacturing problem. Since it does not show up when the tablet is viewed from any angle except a ridiculously steep angle (I'd never use it this way), I am not going to submit it for warranty. Yes, it is a defect, but it doesn't impact normal use.Summary: A small, very affordable tablet that works well and is convenient to carry. Highly recommended.UPDATED BENCHMARKS Dec 2013:3d Mark Ice Storm:Score 6739 | Graphics 6403 | Physics 8253 | Graphics 1 31.3 | Graphics 2 25.1Ice Storm Extreme:Score 3695 | Graphics 3192 | Physics 8244 | Graphics 1 - 18.1 | Graphics 2 - 26.2 | Physics 26.2Ice Storm Unlimited:Score 6112 | Graphics 5624 | Physics 8778 | Graphics 1 33.7 | Graphics 2 19.2 | Physics 27.9Antutu Benchmark:Overall 18564 | Multitask 2776 | Dalvik 1274 | CPU Integer 1357 | CPU Floating point 1508 | RAM Operation 1120 | Ram Speed 1463 | 2D Graphics [800x1216] 1408 | 3d Graphics [800x1216] 5916 | Storage I/O 1127 | Database IO 615.

Reviews.Title: its a good tablet....but
Reviews.Author: John Russell
Reviews.Content: so far so good. I like everything about this tablet. its fast and works very well, A lot of people complain about the screen its not a bad screen really. It could be better but i have seen much worse too. I am comparing this to a galaxy player that i had. This is a million times better then it ever was except for one thing. and that would be my biggest complaint about the dell venue is the camera's there is tablets out there for half this price with cameras twice as good as these are the camera on the front is completely useless for me, its way to blurry and you have to have a ton of light to even see anything and the back camera is the same way, it just does not take clear pictures at all, but i did expect that after seeing other reviews, just didn't thinking it would really be that bad.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased.Overall good deal.I admit I did not get my hopes up when I ordered it - $150 for 7" tablet? When the "big names" are selling at two to three times as much (or more)?But I am quite happy with it.* It is lightweight. A great size too - can hold it easily in one hand and navigate with the other.* Screen is bright enough to see on a sunny day.* Speed/Performance is very smooth. All my favorite Android apps run on it. (I was wondering about that since it's an Intel chip versus the ARM usually found on these devices.)* Browsing the web is a breeze (home wifi).Can easily zoom in out on the page areas for reading - double tap and/or pinching both work nicely.* In general, a 7" screen is a bit small to watch movies. But the Venue plays them very well and sharp and crisp too.* Downside is maybe battery life. But even that isn't too bad.Just to see how it would do ... I used it at full screen brightness, playing HD video not stop streamed off the network -- and it lasted over 6 hours. (about 4 hours or so to recharge it from 0)

Reviews.Title: Great tablet - (I wanted it mine for .cbr files as well as other multimedia demands)
Reviews.Author: TorridlyBoredShopper "T(to the)B(to the)S"
Reviews.Content: I've been slow to pick up a new tablet after purchasing one a few years back, finding that initial exposure disappointing. A couple of months ago I did get  a new one for my wife, and after playing with hers for a little while I decided I needed one of my own.I'm really, really glad I got this model. I like it enough that I'm going to purchase another as a gift for family. With the holidays fast approaching, it would be a good addition for application use. My mother wants something that streams for shopping and watching videos and for applications like the bible online, and she also wants games. This handles all those well, plus it is easy to  use even if a person isn't so computer savvy.  The device is durable, lightweight, and you can see it well on bright days.I always hated not being able to do that - what's the point otherwise? It loads fast, processes well, and has all the user-friendly features I would want. You can easily access the menus, change settings, place applications or widgets where you want. The picture quality is great, coming in  above my expectations, and the sound is nice. Accessing files from the SD card is easy, with everything loading fairly quickly. When you look at the price, it well surpasses others in the range too.And battery life - that's been good.Battery life has always been a sticking point with others, because they die so easily. This one, with features you can tinker with to save more energy, lasts a good deal longer than I expected. If I play games it burns it faster, but when I'm reading in the day or travelling and wanting to use it, it holds up well. The device charges decently fast too, which is pretty nice.One thing I really wanted for myself was something that could easily read .cbr files (comic books) and .pdf files so I could carry them on the go. I have a Kindle but  Kindles have an issue with that; they put borders around comics if you convert them yourself, making it tiny. Even when you add applications, they have yet to handle it well. This does a great job with them. I use Comicrack since I've used them for a long time and Foxit PDF for my PDF files; there are other programs but these do a great job.Very pleased with this item!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Iowa 50126
Reviews.Content: I've had PC's for almost 20 years. But, I was born when Truman was president so my addiction to being on-line is minimal.  My requirements for speed and data storage are easily met by this device.  This is my first tablet. I bought it to use when I travel and to read Kindle books. I'm now using it all over the house. In my shop to look up some parts and plans. In the "throne room" to read the morning newspapers. And ... it also works great for Kindle books.

Reviews.Title: Nice basic tablet; things to consider
Reviews.Author: Sunny Sewing Honeybee
Reviews.Content: I'm really pleased with this tablet. It's thin, light, and not clunky at all--operation is very smooth. The screen has pretty good touch recognition (more on this later), and the screen is bright and clear. The WiFi connectivity is quite good (While this will vary based on your WiFi, of course, I do have a tablet that can't pick up a signal where this one can, so I'm referring to the tablet's ability itself).The rest of my review may sound negative, but it's not--it's really just the things I noticed that I thought might help you with making a purchasing decision.THE PHYSICAL TABLETIt's a nice size, although I'd recommend possibly going up to the 8 if you don't mind a larger size. I can see doing that if you're all thumbs. What I've found is that it can be a challenge for me to touch exactly the right thing, especially with long fingernails. I tried a few different stylus styles, and the one that has worked for me is a wide rubber tip stylus (which mimics a fingertip). It especially comes in handy for Internet surfing or when you need to click/select something very small. But if you're a bit clumsy with small screens, that might be something to keep in mind--especially if you plan to do any sort of word processing (without a keyboard) or e-mail. Certainly it's easier to use than a smartphone, though. And while I've seen it elsewhere mentioned as being pocket sized, you'd have to have rather large pockets to accommodate the dimensions (It doesn't fit any pockets I have).The speaker is located on the bottom (when held the tall way). It probably would have been better for it to be on the top/side, since if it's propped up on something, the sound gets a bit muffled.If a camera feature is important to you, then the one in this tablet may not be sufficient--it's really just passable.USING, CHARGING, CONVENIENCE, ETC.Turning the tablet on is a bit of a learning curve. I have to hold the button down for several seconds until the DELL logo shows up. Additionally, the screen blacks out pretty quickly, and this button has to be pressed to bring it back. When you use the tablet, you must drag the "locked" area to another one on the screen--I turned this feature off after figuring it out.Perhaps I'm one of the few people in the world who didn't have one, but you have to have a Google account to get the most out of the tablet, such as being able to use Google Play and download apps. The process is easy, but I recommend trying to sign up from a desktop computer. When I tried to sign up on the tablet, anything--even highly obscure--I input for a new username said it was unavailable. I switched to a desktop, put in one of the same terms, and registered that way. It doesn't take too long to get an account.The battery life isn't all that long--you'll likely need to plug it in once a day if you plan to use the tablet daily. However, it's convenient and this comes with an adapter for a wall outlet (unlike some tablets!).My main surprise with this tablet was that it didn't come with a print manual! While a lot of what's on it is intuitive to figure out, and the best way to learn might be by exploring it, I'm the type of person who likes to have a manual due to being intimidated by unfamiliar technology.I've tried to be honest about things, to the point where it possibly sounds like I don't like the tablet. I really do like it! These are just things I know I would have wanted to know before getting one, and thought would be things you might want to consider. I'm really happy with the tablet and its processing speed and other basics.

Reviews.Title: 1 week in
Reviews.Author: LIFEisSHORT
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome so far. My first tablet, this thing is just an over sized smart phone. Comparing it to my HTC ONE X Plus, it does everything my phone does with a bigger screen. Google Earth, Field Runners, Temple Run 2, Yahoo Fantasy Football, Google Drive,World of Goo, TW Battles, Google Play Store, Netflix.....plays them all no problem.  $150 well spent!

Reviews.Title: exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: kevin98
Reviews.Content: i bought these to use as an mp3 player. keep in mind it takes micro sdxc, not sdxc as the specs say. the biggest micro sdxc you can get is 64gb right now ( not 128gb)  the processor is decent but obviously not as good what you will get in a more expensive tablet. android is 'barebones' without bloatware and i love that. the screen is good but not great. the speakers are pretty bad sounding unfortunately, but the sound sounds great on headphones.will recommend and this will do most of what you will need in a tablet. unless you need to take notes or sketch and then you might want to get a more expensive one with a stylus.

Reviews.Title: Lean Mean Tablet Machine
Reviews.Author: Pomegranate
Reviews.Content: I have owned 6 of the Dell Venue 7 16GB tablets for work for a few weeks, and they are great. I use them to train employees and do fieldwork. Here is my impression of this tablet, short and sweet:PROS:- Pure Android, pure bliss. No proprietary Apple, Microsoft or Amazon nonsense. I can download apps and executable files without going through an "app store."- If the apps/programs you want are standard, you will definitely find them in the Google Play store. Google's suite of products is arguably the best among the competitors.- Runs browsers and web content like a PC, but with the touchscreen ease of a smartphone. I was surprised how smooth this is. The same content will load in the browser or in an app with equal speed and display. The default browser that comes with the tablet is Google Chrome, an excellent browser.- Multi-tasking does not seem to slow down this tablet, such as streaming music simultaneously to doing work on the web/apps.- The tablet is fully integrated with Google, so if you choose to sign in with your Google account, all of your data syncs.- BUT!!!!!!!!! If you choose not to sign in with Google (or don't want a Google account), everything still works wonderfully. I love that the option exists to sync or not to sync, depending on personal preference. The consumer is not pressured into a cloud storage program, or into yet another software subscription, or into jailbreaking the device to keep one's sanity.- YOU CAN ADD STORAGE!!!!!!!!!!!!! The SD card reader will take additional storage up to 128GB!- The power supply is delivered by Micro USB connection, which is very convenient since almost all of the good devices use this now. In a pinch, I can charge it with my cell phone (Samsung Galaxy) cord, or vice versa.- It is so light and thin, but it doesn't seem fragile. I dropped it while doing fieldwork out on a boat onto a hard aluminum surface, and it didn't get a scratch.- The audio sounds surprisingly full, not tinny and hard to hear as with many smaller devices. Earbuds get excellent sound quality as well from the audio jack.- The security, wifi, accessibility, and preference settings are easy to understand. You can set more than one user account.- The battery lasts all day. I haven't tested it specifically for battery life, but I did use it recently on and off all day (probably 6 hours active) using various programs/camera, and it was only drawn down to 64% battery.- The 7" screen is large enough to effectively use the touch keyboard to take notes, send emails, review documents, etc. for those interested in workplace applications. I am toying with the idea of a plugin/Bluetooth keyboard but it doesn't seem necessary.-$149? I can buy 2-3 of these for the same price as an iPad Mini!CONS:- The cameras aren't spectacular, but what do you expect from an amazing tablet priced at $149 MSRP? Don't you have a smartphone with a gazillion megapixel camera anyway??? The rear camera takes totally acceptable quality photos with good colors and light detection, but the front camera is basically just OK -- sufficient for Skype and FaceTime (or the odd selfie) but does not have very high resolution or intense colors.BOTTOM LINE;- With the incredible price point and rock solid features, I will be buying about a dozen more of these for our office in the next year.P. S. The Dell Venue 8" has almost the exact same features, and while I would prefer the larger size screen for personal use, the smaller 7" screen is ideal because it's a little lighter and takes up less space for travel/work.

Reviews.Title: Buy this tablet, it's worth the money. Powerful, good screen, decent battery life.
Reviews.Author: Tom B.
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for the money. It is sturdy, lightweight, and easy to use.The tablet has a good weight for its size. It featues a 7 inch screen, the back of the devise smooth matte black with the Dell logo on it.The power button is on the top right, Volume rocker buttons are on the left along with the micro USB port (used for charging with the included charger or for connecting to your computer) The right has an expansion slot for a micro SD card.It runs Android 4.2.2. If you are at all familiar with Android this will be a snap. I have a Samsung Galaxy and they are pretty much identical in the way they operate. Only difference is the slight additions that Samsung adds to their phone operating system user interface. The system is pretty clear of bloatware, so there are very few apps that usually come preloaded on your phones.Setup is easy. Answer a few questions and you are off and running. If you have a google account (gmail, google plus) you enter that and you can begin downloading apps you've previously downloaded on our phone or purchased.The system runs very smooth and fast. It boots in under 30 seconds. Switching screens, loading apps, and opening menus is blazingly fast. It is really really fast.The screen is very bright and can be viewed at some intense angles and it looks very good.The front facing camera is decent, though not excellent. It comes in at about 3 megapixels, pretty good for taking photos. They are a bit grainy, though passable. Definable will not replace your regular camera. The rear facing camera is not good at all, you will not be taking very good selfies with this. It is passable, though, for doing things like Skype or participating in a Google hangout or video conference it will do a good job because you usually don't want to broadcast on too high a resolution anyway.Most any google apps will run on this. I've seen no problems or incompatible apps. I've used Netflix, Hula, Pandora, and others. They load fast and multimedia looks good.This does not run flash! So if you want to view sits like Amazon streaming movies you will have a hard time. I am looking for a workaround, but as of writing this have not found one.The sound quality is very good. the speakers are on the bottom and they sound pretty good. There is a headphone/data port on the top. So you can listen to music with headphones or use an input device such as a credit card reader like I have with the Square Register app or with headphone/microphone devices.Battery life is good. If you are using it hard, you'll have to charge it every evening, though if you use it here and there, you can get a few days out of it.It also has Bluetooth connectivity and it has worked well connecting to my various devices. Wireless is fast and easy to set upThe only weird thing is the micro USB cord seems to be upside down. That is though the plug fits in snugly to the device, it seems contrary to what you expect. I'm always trying to put the USB connector in upside down. Just kind of funny and does not diminish the device.Overall a sturdy capable tablet. Runs very fast, good battery life, clear screen, and good sound. Will run most any app you'd care to run. If you are familiar with Android, you'll have no problems using this and it'll seem like old hat. Very easy to learn, setup, and use.I highly recommend!!UPDATE!!:: As of December 19th, 2013 there is an OS upgrade. This now runs Android 4.3. If you have this already and it is NOT running 4.3, go to Settings/About Tablet/system updates

Reviews.Title: Name brand with 2GB RAM at no-name 1GB price.  There are rough edges but exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: I mildly considered buying this table because it is one of the few atom-based tablets available, which I heard has a good power-to-performance ratio (even with Haskwell on the horizon).  At the various price points, I would really only consider the Nexus 7, Kindle HDX (Amazon has earned my business and loyalty), and this model.  When I noticed that a local electronic chain had it on sale for $30 off, and had stock at a store nearby, it was a no-brainer to pull the trigger.  It is a Dell, after all, and it's got 2GB RAM, 16GB of storage with SD expansion capability.  At this price, I wouldn't sweat it if my daughter (or myself) accidentally drop it on the floor.A few points after ~24 hours of heavy use:- If you are sensitive to non-uniform backlight, this model (or my particular unit) would bother you, when the background is black.  I will try to post a picture.  It is hardly noticeable on anything else other than pure black.- It does not last through the day, with ~3 hours of game play (my daughter).  This may be due to the game being poorly written though, as the background music continues even with screen off (game should have been suspended).  The tablet also gets warm- 2GB really makes a difference, a lesson I learned from my phones before getting a Nexus 4.- There were cases when my daughter had trouble clicking on icons, but the touch screen seems pretty responsive to me.- The front and back cameras are nothing to write home about, consistent with everything I have read.  It's passable for video chat I suppose in a well-lit area.- 1280x800 (pixel density not as high as higher end tablets) isn't very noticeable.  I loaded my kindle app and read a few pages to try it out.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: SUDS "SS"
Reviews.Content: I had previously purchased the Lenovo A3000 for my son and wanted to purchase a second one for my other son. I tried to order it from Lenovo, but the ship date was far out. I had planned to give it to my son for his birthday and it was not anticipated to ship till a good month later. I found this on Dell's website and thought it seemed comparable. It is very comparable. I think that the speaker on this device is not quite as good as the speaker on the Lenovo, but it is for a little kid and I don't think he would appreciate the difference. The difference is not all that big. I prefer the way that you access the memory card on this device over the Lenovo. With the Dell there is a little door of sorts on the side of the device that you open to insert or remove the memory card. For the Lenovo I need to take the device out of the case and then remove the back of the device to get to the memory card slot. Once you get to the memory card on the Lenovo it is quite difficult to remove the card. With this Dell Venue 7 I find that it is easy to insert and remove the memory card.The sound and the memory card are the main differences between the Lenovo A3000 and this device. The Dell Venue 7 functions similarly to other Android devices. The power on the two devices seems similar. I think this device may be slightly smaller than the Lenovo A3000, but they both fit into the generic 7 inch tablet kids case so they could not be that different.I would recommend this or the Lenovo A3000 equally. I paid $20 more for this device simply because I could get a firm ship date versus the Lenovo which I could not get a ship date. The main recommendation that I have when buying a tablet is to look for a device with removable media. We have a 16 GB iPad, it is still receiving updates, but 16 GB just is not enough memory and it seems crazy to pay $100 or so for an extra 16GB of memory when I was able to get a free 16 GB micro SD card for my son's Lenovo tablet. We have two tablets for under $300 where a 16GB iPad mini would be $399. The kids games on Androids are fairly comparable. Most games are available for both operating systems and it is much easier to learn how to use an Android than I had anticipated. You can also find apps that will allow you to sync music, movies, contacts and calendars with your itunes and icloud. This allows for a much more seamless transition.I hope you find this helpful! Feel free to ask me questions.We own the following:Samsung Note 8iPad 2 - 16 GBLenovo A3000Dell Venue 7

Reviews.Title: Music playback way too quiet
Reviews.Author: J. Rivas
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm pleased with this tablet.  It does what it's supposed to do, the apps download fast and run at a decent speed, the wifi has been very reliable, it's a good product.  However listening to music (one of the main reasons I got this) is not enjoyable at all.I understand how these days they want to avoid any potential liability but they've taken it too far.  I can hear the music but the max volume is way too low.  I've tried various mp3 player apps as well as several headphones, so it's clearly a limitation of the tablet itself (i know someone's going to not read this and suggest it anyway but gonna stress it nonetheless in the hopes that someone actually READS THIS).  My favorite headphones are Klipsh earbuds and they work great on every other device.If anyone knows of a way of increasing the max volume I'd greatly appreciate it if you could let me know, but I wouldn't have bought this if I knew it was going to be this bad.  For many people maybe it's loud enough, but I like my music a bit on the loud side.

Reviews.Title: Nailed it, Dell.
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Zakrzewski
Reviews.Content: I was wary and very particular about the specs I was looking for in a tablet. I spent more than three weeks searching for a tablet with decent processing speed and video capabilities, and eventually came across this. The mixed reviews set alarms off at first, but couldn't find anything with a 2 GB processor and 2 GB of RAM for a better price. So I went out on a limb and bought this tablet with a 32 GB hard drive, and prayed it would show up unharmed and functioning.Once I got the tablet I was presently surprised at how fast it powered on and I saw what other reviewers had already talked about. Little bloatware, speedy and great HD picture. I am a gamer to the core, and this tablet plays every game I have installed flawlessly. I haven't found a single issue with ANYTHING. It is faster and easier to use than my laptop, so I end up spending more time on my tablet, instead.  XD  Here is a detailed breakdown of the Pros and Con's.Pros - Fast, Good Video Quality, Sound is crisp for only having one speaker and is louder than you would expect, charges relatively quickly, size makes for easy navigation and use of virtual controls when playing highly demanding games such as MOBAs, full 3D FPSs, and RTSs, and has a nice feel when holding it. Also, doesn't feel flimsy.Cons - It *DOES* have only one speaker, so sound quality could be much better, but plug in some headphones and you won't notice a difference. Also, related to sound, I like to watch Netflix at night while I'm in bed with my one year old and fiance', and the sound can't be adjusted by percentages. Meaning that there are "steps" in which it automatically is set to. So when you push the volume button up one "step" it is a pretty big difference in how loud it is. There is no slider to adjust volume, so it is either too loud or too quiet for my liking. But this is a very miniscule inconvenience, because I can use headphones. Other than that, the only other problem I have with the dell venue 7 is that the charger port has gotten a little loose and the charger moves around a bit when plugged in. Although this doesn't stop the tablet for on charging,so its really just st a pet peeve of mine. XDSide notes - I have had this tablet for a couple months now for your knowledge. My baby girl and fiance' love to use the tablet as well for reading and learning apps. The app store is in no shortage of these and it is a good feeling to know that my 15 month old is having fun while learning. Also, I am currently ordering a Bluetooth keyboard/case combo and Bluetooth mouse, so I will update when they arrive to discuss how well they work. All in all, I am very pleased with this product, and will be getting another for my soon to be wife. Hope this is useful to everyone! Dell NAILED it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product from Dell
Reviews.Author: V. Garcia Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Very fast. Size and weight appropriate. The video quality is excellent. Very good start to Dell in the tablet with Android. Excellent quality. Recommended entirely. We add one 64GB microSD and it works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: NOT Recommended
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Dell Venue 7 tablet is SLOW, has terrible battery life (typical for Dell tablets), and "glitches" all the time.  In the last month, I've had to do hard-resets at least three times.  I think all of the performance/functionality issues are, as others have pointed out, because the Intel Atom processor is not optimized for Android, and visa-versa.There are a total of seven android tablets in our household: 2x Dell, 2x Samsung, 2x Asus, and 1x Acer (yes, we're geeks). The Asus Prime tablets are the fastest, followed by the Samsung Galaxy Tabs. The Samsungs have better features and longer battery life. The Dell Streak 7 (Dell's previous 7" tablet) and the Acer Icona Tab are about tied for speed and functionality, but the Dell's battery life leaves you tethered to a plug after about 2 hours of use. In last place is the Dell Venue 7 -- BY FAR the weakest performer of the bunch. All of our tablets get used frequently, EXCEPT the Venue. We wanted to like it and give it a chance, but no joy...Time will tell if Dell bothers to address any of the Venue’s issues, but I’m not holding my breath.  Dell’s track record of supporting their tablets is absolutely shameful – just ask owners of Dell Streak tablets who were left high and dry when Dell “temporarily” abandoned the tablet market in 2011 (myself included).  ALL support for Dell tablets promptly vanished by early 2012. Dell not only abandoned the tablet market, they also abandoned their customers.  Now that Dell is back in the tablet market, there is little reason to hope they've improved their technical support base.Bottom line: I cannot, in good faith, recommend this tablet.  You can find better for less out there...

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: starbox189
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for a few days now. and I really like it.  Immediately updated to Jelly Beam 4.3.  I bought it to replace my previous Samsung 7 Tab 2 which was a piece of junk.  Wouldn't update past 4.1.  That tablet would not keep a wifi connection and loose it when ever I moved into the next room.  It was very slow to impossible to down load webpages.  Very frustrating.  This Dell maintains a strong connection throughout the house which is essential and downloads very quickly.  The screen is very sharp, too.  Very pleased.  Plus is has a micro SD card slot.  Wouldn't have a tablet without one.  It was very reasonably priced at $149.  Definitely would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Dell Venue 7 tablet
Reviews.Author: D. Polwort "DP"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tablet and found that I was able to get it at a very reasonable price.  I also received it prior to the promised delivery date.  I am very happy with its performance and easiness in operation.

Reviews.Title: Con was the battery life
Reviews.Author: Juan Vasquez
Reviews.Content: They claim to last up to 10hrs of battery life. Its not bad, not great either, but its about the same as the Nextbook 8 SE Premium (great tablet for 99$). About 6 hrs.Other than is a great purchase; fast, awesome screen resolution, great screen can easily be cleaned up, and android 4.2.2, still no upgrade.Update on the battery life, it will depend a lot on the use of the tablet, doing a little bit of everything it might last over a day or 2, unless you play 6 straight hrs or watch movies.

Reviews.Title: Love it so much
Reviews.Author: evelina
Reviews.Content: I bought Kindle Fire HD just few days before Dell launched Venue 7And after reading all specification from Dell Venue 7, i already immediately felt regret (even before Kindle was delivered) but I told myself I would give Kindle a try. Later i bought Dell Venue 7 and return Kindle.Below is the comparison :Pro of Dell Venue 7 vs Kindle Fire HDDell has all below which Kindle Fire HD does not have- 2 Camera front and back, even with zoom- GPS so also has navigation turn by turn, even in the car (with no wifi obviously). what you need is to load the map in the wifi area before you start driving (save you money to buy GPS)- Microphone so also have voice command, speech to text (good for people who type very slow),- can download free voice recorder apps with 100+ hours and skip blank function,- can do free call with skype, mango etc and- with Groove Ip Lite it turns tablet into phone and make free call to any US phone number (either land line or cell number)- Micro SD card for additional storage up to 32GB- Bluetooth, easier transferring files between laptop to tablet or vice versa- Gmail application pre-installed vs must buy $5 in kindle fire- Youtube application- Speed : Dell 2Ghz Dual Core vs Kindle 1.5Ghz Dual Core- RAM : Dell 2GB vs Kindle 1GB so Dell is really very fast- Flash Memory : Dell 16 GB vs Kindle 8 GB, more storage in Dell- Browser : Dell Chrome browser hold the page while Kindle Silk Browser will need to re-download the page every time u change screen so resulting in waiting time. to download Chrome browser in Kindle is another $5Dell has two browser, in case you need to save different password in different browser- Dell email apps for multiple emails account shows complete name or user define name vs kindle name it with gmail1, gmail2, gmail3, very confusing and you dont know which is which- Dell is lighter 0.69lb = 11oz vs Kindle 12.2oz so no sore hand holding it up for a long time- Dell width 4.65" vs Kindle 5" so easier to hold with palm (without need to stretch the palm all the way for people with small hand)Pro of Kindle Fire HD vs Dell Venue 7- Dell less wide screen results in smaller on screen keyboard so the swype keyboard often interpret wrongly- Battery Dell 5 hours average vs Kindle 10 hours, but as long as you always remember to turn off screen whenever it is not used, with heavy browsing and about 30-40 email per day, it last whole day without charge- Speaker Dell mono vs Kindle Dolby Stereo, but for me who seldom watch movie it makes no differenceDell only $10 ($149) more than Kindle ($139),with Dell pre-installed Gmal apps and Chrome browser apps $5 each, make both price equal.no one should ever consider kindle at all. too bad Dell is lack of advertisement so not so many people know the many plus points of Dell Venue 7 vs Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Title: Can't store program data to SD card
Reviews.Author: Tim is me
Reviews.Content: Fair warning: This tablet won't allow you to store app data to the external SD card. This is a feature which is available in Android but which they left as an option for manufacturers to enable or not, and Dell chose to disable it. You can still store media (pictures, music, videos etc.) on the external card, but if you use apps that store data (in my case, GPS maps) you can ONLY save the data to the 16GB internal memory. Since I purchased this tablet solely for use as a GPS device this is a HUGE letdown for me. YMMV

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled by the size!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was concerned my 2 adult children would not be happy with this smaller tablet, but I was oh so wrong! I bought each of them one for Christmas 2013 and they were super excited.  They use them almost non-stop for everything from Facebook to streaming videos and everything in between...and it's a Dell!! They auto-updated as soon as the devices were turned on with super easy setup to our secured wireless! Absolutely no issues/complaints about this product.  What more could you ask for??

Reviews.Title: Floored by Features
Reviews.Author: Randall Rap
Reviews.Content: I'd been shopping for tablets since Black Friday.  Just bought this Dell Venue 7 (model 3730).  It isn't a 2.0Ghz dual-core chip, but is a 1.6Ghz dual-core.  So on that count, it's better than the lower priced Lenova IdealTab A1000 series AND the higher priced Samsung Tab 3 7" where both are running a 1.2Ghz dual-core.  Plus the Venue has hyper-threading!  The screen resolution is yet another reason... 1280x800 (or low HD) versus the 1024x600 on the other two models mentioned.  Plus came with 2Gb RAM versus their 1Gb... and has 16Gb storage.  The camera would have been a reason to only check 4 stars, but is a feature I'm not planning on using so 3MP for the rear-facing camera is fine by me.  Tablet is responsive, switches apps quickly and videos look wonderful.  The screen might be more touch-responsive or it could be the plastic film protector which makes it a bit less than normal.  After downloading the PDF manual, finding there isn't a thing to detract from this product.  I would DEFINITELY recommend it to friends/family, even over the Samsung Tab 3 if it were the exact same price.

Reviews.Title: Replaced Kindle Fire With This
Reviews.Author: mb
Reviews.Content: Does the job. Battery seems to last longer. More apps available (google play store). Would recommend over the original Fire.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Tablet, But Keep Your Old MP3 Player
Reviews.Author: George Fleming
Reviews.Content: I have owned this for a month and find that it is a well built Android tablet with good performance and battery life. I picked this Dell based on the online specs and description, and for the most part I have not been disappointed. I would recommend this model to anyone who only wants to use Wi-Fi,  As a handy computing tool away from the laptop, I am well pleased. Now that I have said that, let me get a little more critical, while admitting that any problems could be my error.  I could have wished for better printed instructions. The small difficulties I have are probably due to the operating system and not the hardware. First, for some reason it did not connect to my older Belkin-G router, so I bought a new router and it worked fine. This was strange because other laptops and tablets could connected OK, and the Dell Venue had no problem on a couple public networks that I tried. Also, I have tried three different MP3 playing apps and sometimes no audio will come out. When this happens, I can still get audio from a piano app. So it seems this must be software related. I am hoping that perhaps an update to Android will fix this problem. Finally, I do not know if all Android tablets do this, but it seems that the extra SD micro memory chip is not automatically mounted by the system unless you pull it out and re- insert it after every reboot. Since I reboot often, the SD micro memory slot seems useless for local storage.

Reviews.Title: A good little tablet at a good little price
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This product has been a surprisingly good value!  At $150, this little table not only offers Wireless Display, but a very comparable battery life to other more expensive tablets.  Having used this tablet now for several weeks, the only downside I've encountered is the aforementioned battery life, but I'd have that with almost every tablet of this size.  The Dell Venue 7 seems sturdy enough for a responsible user, while being supported by a decent company which has a history of offering reasonable customer service.  While I cannot speak to the next generation of these tablets from Dell, I can say that this unit is great for a first time tablet user.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: MacGregor
Reviews.Content: I am having so much fun with this tablet. I am elderly and was worried that I wouldn't get the hang of it without a lot of effort, but it is a delight to use! I'm enjoying books, news articles, email, and many other features. My only regret is that I didn't get a 10-inch. Didn't realize I'd be using it so much.

Reviews.Title: A must have product
Reviews.Author: ynolton
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this item an it has exceeded my expectation. The description given online regrading this item is very accurate. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: Scott M. "SAM"
Reviews.Content: Well, this is my first tablet, so I have nothing to compare it to.  I'm a retired techie, happy with my laptop, but everyone asks me about tablets and I have no experience with them so I thought it was time.  I got the one with only wifi & bluetooth connectivity.  I've had it a week or so and have no complaints.  I was concerned about the small speaker on the side, but I've found cupping my hand directs it at me.  I don't play a lot of 'action' games, so I don't know how well they perform.  Camera isn't as good as some, but it works.  Seems to be plenty of memory and storage for all the apps I'm finding. The GPS with the google maps is cool, it actually pinpointed the part of the house I was sitting in and works from inside the house.  I REALLY like the Android 4.2, I wish they had a beefed up version I could run on my laptop instead of the new Windows 8.1.....  I had thought of buying a Lenovo.  I had an issue with Lenovo sales that was going to cost me $20 more, after requesting a supervisor, I was told that "I was at the end of the line".  If that happens with Lenovo sales, I can only imagine what happens with their support.  I've worked with Dells for years and have always seemed of good quality as this does.  This had twice the memory (2Gig) of the Lenovo and the Intel processor.  The charging cord is EXTREMELY short, so buy yourself a longer power cable.  I did connect the tablet to the laptop and I can access the files on the tablet, but USB adapter on the tablet isn't the standard micro-USB.  It looks very similar, but they are different. I've streamed some videos and they seem to work quite well.  The case seems to be quite rugged too.  Since I'm using it mostly at home, it's been plugged in, so I can't give an honest report on battery life.

Reviews.Title: Dell Venue 7 16GB
Reviews.Author: Shahjada I.
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet to use at school for reading, taking notes, listening to music, and to browse the web.  I like it because the 2GB of RAM and 1.6ghz Intel Atom processor and means the tablet runs pretty fast, and is OK with multitasking.  I also love the new version of Android.  Would be better if it had more preinstalled apps though (such as an office app) and more widgets, and if there was a way to sync it to my computer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet!
Reviews.Author: BillVN
Reviews.Content: Initially I wanted a Nexus 7 2013 based on features, specs, and on-line reviews. When I dug a bit deeper I found there are a number of quality issues and many users are not happy. So I decided to look further. My requirements are:1. Replace my 4 year old Kindle for reading.2. General web surfing.3. Play on/offline games.4. Play movies, music, videos, and photos.5. Good quality, hi-res screen, fast Wifi, good battery life, recent pure Android OS, Google Play, Chrome, YouTube, GPS, cameras, Bluetooth, expandable memory, no apps I don't need, and reasonably priced.So, after further research, I decided to try the new Dell Venue 7. It looked like it met the above requirements, online reviews looked good, and I like that it has a Gorilla glass screen.I have had it for a week and this is what I think.- The screen has excellent resolution, clarity, and colors, but I would prefer a less glossy screen.- Wifi connected easily and works well. It appears to have good range.- Battery life seems adequate. I played a 2.5hr movie and still had 66% battery. It seems to charge quickly.- Works great as a Kindle replacement. Loaded up the free Kindle app and it works very well inside or outside (in the shade). Not good in bright sun due to the glossy screen.- Excellent for the web surfing (Chrome), Gmail/calendar, Facebook, online banking, news, etc.- Downloaded free apps for chess, solitaire, and poker. They are very enjoyable on this tablet.I also downloaded free apps for games such as car racing, shooting, and geocaching to make sure the internal sensors worked properly. They did and I noticed no response lag.- Loaded up a movie from Google play and was very impressed with the video. Sound from the speaker was ok but much better with a headset.- Loaded a bunch of music and photos from my computer onto a 32GB micro SD card that I installed. I was amazed at the quality of the sound with a cheap headset and the beautiful photos.- I verified the Bluetooth, GPS, and cameras work well. The cameras are weak but useable.- I really like the pure Android and lack of bloat-ware.Bottom line, I really like it. For my needs, this beats out the Kindle Fire and Nexus 7 (2013).I think I made a good purchase at an excellent price.I hope it is as reliable as other Dell products I have owned.I will try to update this review if anything changes.12/22/13 update:Tablet still working fine. Updated to Android 4.3 - no significant changes.1. Tired of glossy screen and finger prints? The matte screen helped me:  Evecase Clear & Anti-Glare Matte Screen Protector Mix Set for Dell Venue 7 - 7.0 inch IPS Screen Android Tablet - 4-Pack2. I bought and like this case: Evecase SlimBook Leather HandStrap Folio Stand Case Cover for Dell Venue 7 - 7.0'' IPS Screen Android Tablet (Black)3. Here are a couple of apps that can greatly improve the tablet:AVG Antivirus Security - FREEEasy Battery Saver - Free (on that other app site)

Reviews.Title: crashes !!!!
Reviews.Author: smoke
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews sounded like a great tablet for the price.Was so dissapointed, the minute I started using it it would freeze up and reboot. When it did stay on it was fast and nice quality screen. I think it must of been defected. Had to send it back I  ordered a nexus 7. Hope I have been luck with this one.I must say amazon was fantastic about the return!!! No question asked and did not have to pay to ship it back. I never worry when I order anything from amazon!! The best customer service anywhere

Reviews.Title: Dell crafted a very solid, low-cost Android tablet
Reviews.Author: Cashcar1979
Reviews.Content: Paid $139 for this, and its a nice little tablet for the price.  Solid build quality, decent enough speed, and nice HD screen.  No this isn't as high end as the Nexus 7, but keep in mind its nearly $100 less!!  Excellent low cost device for the kids.

Reviews.Title: Dell Venue tablet
Reviews.Author: Donna Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, it has just about everything anyone could want in a tablet. It is very versible. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Dianna Baker
Reviews.Content: Really nice tablet, another great dell product! Wasnt looking to spend to much and im really happy with this tablet. Perfect for me, fits right in my purse!

Reviews.Title: fast, good size, good price
Reviews.Author: smileylizard
Reviews.Content: 2 gb RAM helps out alot. I purchased it for $150 from Amazon. Not sure if they sell this model anymore. I haven't checked on sim card status yet. as i have mobile hotspot. The back camera sensor is a bit weak, but takes much better photos than i anticipated. by far the best out of five tablets i've owned including asus tft 300

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I needed a small tablet for email, facebook, photos, watching video and the occasional book (when I've forgotten my kindle). At $150 this has surprisingly good battery life and is well built and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't expecting so much for the price!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Anibal Alanis
Reviews.Content: I bought this primarily cause it was cheap, and I just wanted a tablet to play games on. I use to have a Nexus 7 (2012) edition, but I dropped it, so I bought this as a replacement. Turns out it works just as good as my old Nexus 7 (2012) edition or even better. There is no lagging, and the graphics while playing games are amazing. Only thing I didn't like was the front facing camera, it's kind of blurry when I use it. Overall it's definitely one of the best tablets for less then $200.

Reviews.Author: ed vick
Reviews.Content: Ordered two tablets for Christmas gifts. One operates fine the other turns itself off once in sleep mode and then takes several attempts to get it powered on again.

Reviews.Title: Nothing to envy from apple Ipad2
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: In my house there are three tablets, Ipad2 16GB, Blackberry 16GB (the worst investment of my life), and 2 months ago I bought my new Dell Venue 7 16 GB Tablet, for me it is as good in every way as Apple Ipad2, nothing to envy, 100% recommend this tablet, as your camera is read in another review so regular, but I assure q the main objective of most buyers, is not having it as a photographic camera, it is important to be fast and multifunctional, with android system you can set you all the app you want, also if you buy a 64GB external memory, you have all the desired space, do not hesitate to buy thismagnificent tablet.JohnJ.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablets!
Reviews.Author: Jason Sanchez
Reviews.Content: We bought these tablets for my kids for Christmas. We got them in the other day and began to fiddle with them (had to get them all set up before we wrap them up for Christmas). And man I've got to say, these are some great tablets!

Reviews.Title: One Day Wonder
Reviews.Author: Kathryn E. Etier "Miss Bob"
Reviews.Content: One thing about those folks at Dell--they have a great sense of humor. My husband, a dedicated Dell PC user, was buying a new desktop and the fellow at Dell told him that because of his purchase he qualified to get this Dell Tablet for only $150, which is only one cent higher than Amazon and big box stores are charging (he didn't mention that part).The problem with this device is that the plug on the charger does not fit snugly in the tablet. Example, I have been recharging the battery for three days and it is all the way up to 5%! The tablet does not run when the charger is plugged in unless it is fully (or mostly) charged. So I used it for a day, and then let it charge overnight. Nothing. Let it charge for days. That worked. But even when I use gravity to keep the charger plugged in, often the thing just doesn't charge.  Now there may be other issuses with the charger or the devices charging mechanism (whatever that may be), but the loose charger that falls out at the thought of moving the tablet is an obvious problem.I don't really need a tablet that may work one day out of ten--I certainly don't need the irritation. As far as my experience goes, the only person who could use this tablet is a dead person.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet but had to return
Reviews.Author: Byron Gourley
Reviews.Content: This tablet was performing nicely, good picture, camera was taking good photos for a tablet of it's price range. After a few days use, the charger connection (mini usb port) on the tablet would not connect and allow the battery to charge. I tried another charger and cable, same results. End result, unit was working nicely but had to be returned.

Reviews.Title: I really like
Reviews.Author: jose valderrama
Reviews.Content: excellent table, is very fast and all applications under heavy game excellent work going very well.is the appropriate size, is lightweight, and storage is good.

Reviews.Title: Dell tablet
Reviews.Author: sassysue
Reviews.Content: I love this Dell tablet.  The size is perfect to fit into a cross body bag, the system is fast and efficient.  The camera takes awesome pictures, and all the apps download very quickly.  Best decision I ever made.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: GREAT PRODUCT.
Reviews.Content: Awesome. Great tablet. I bought for my mom. Easy to use. 16 GB of memory and 2 DDR for velocity,double camera. Works great. defenitely I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: dell tablet
Reviews.Author: Peggy Dalberto
Reviews.Content: First time tablet, got it to use with the square card reader for sales. Easy to figure out how to find settings, etc. I'm not a techy person, but seems easy. Got son-in-law to load apps on, so have no idea about that. He however has "tablet envy" and likes this better than his.  I looked at a Lenovo tablet too, cost less, but the headphone jack and the power point were too close together to have square card reader plugged in and the power cord at same time.  Hence, the dell.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: cell challenged
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for price. Has everything I needed in this product. Needed GPS, Bluetooth,sc card slot,WiFi. Filled all the specs I needed for a good price

Reviews.Title: Exceptional tablet
Reviews.Author: korakas
Reviews.Content: Out family has owned 3 Kindle Fire tablets and has been very pleased with them.  When my husband suggested that we try this Dell tablet for one of the kids, I was a bit skeptical.  However, it's a great tablet ... with a great design and functions.  We liked it so good that we've already purchased a second Dell tablet.  This is a great tablet at a great price.  This has definitely been money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!
Reviews.Author: tangelheart
Reviews.Content: While it isn't the cheapest tablet on the market and it isn't a highend product; it is stable, consistent and does what I need/want. I think the android OS Jellybean is a wonderful improvement to Windows CE.

Reviews.Title: saved our Christmas of 2013.
Reviews.Author: Teresa A.Peterkin
Reviews.Content: The tablet was bought for my husband. Because  I bought  Polaroid Tablet and it was terrible.  I returned it. It was a Christmas gift.  So I looked on line and saw the dell tablet and good price. He loved it. Won't put it down.  Thank you

Reviews.Title: Dell Venu 7"
Reviews.Author: Bill C Clark
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this product.Was very fast, and simple to work with.I would definitly, and highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: maria castro
Reviews.Content: I chose five start because I love it. it is perfect and practical.it is light easy to carry. I would recommended this table.

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: David W. Miller
Reviews.Content: We bought this to take traveling instead of lugging a laptop around. It's great for game play and I can handle what email I need to with it.

Reviews.Title: Great for school
Reviews.Author: MAC
Reviews.Content: I recieved it yesterday so I can't say much about the overall long term performance. It is a great machine, i absolutly love it. it is fast and I can scroll through things quickly. There are some great APPs that I was able to download to take notes and open powerpoints and also write on them. It was really simple to use out of the box. (nothing confusing). I am a college student on a budget, I have a dell laptop that has served me well so this was the best option for me. I don't play games or anything, mostly need it for school so honestly this tablet is great. It doesn't have a USB port.It has the most up to date system so instead of the 4.2 jelly bean everyone is talking about, it has actually been updated to the 4.3 jellybean.It also has the swype keyboard (swipe your fingers through each letter to write words faster) and you can type by speaking. So far I love the tablet, it fits my needs perfectly. I will update in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Charles Crawford "c.c"
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for the price. I would recommend this one for sure. Love it better than the nexus which I returned.

Reviews.Title: Dell tablet�
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Lockhart
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend absolutely loved this tablet that I got him for Christmas. It works pretty good although it's not an iPad. But, for the price I would recommend this to anyone�

Reviews.Title: First Android tablet that I find pleasant to use
Reviews.Author: S. Elam
Reviews.Content: I bought this on dell.com.  It is extremely fast for web browsing, which is really the main requirement I have in a tablet.  The GPS is also good, it's GNSS and works indoors.  The Wifi signal strength is amazingly strong. The headphone jack sound is also very good compared to other tablets I have used.  The only annoyance I have is with the touchscreen not registering clicks in the chrome browser, and accuracy can be a problem when selecting among tightly packed links, though this doesn't happen too often.

Reviews.Title: Dell tablet works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Ricky Johnston
Reviews.Content: This tablet was bought for my wife for Christmas, and she loves it!  It allows her to do everything she needs to do including checking emails, browsing the internet, staying up with social media, and listening to music.  Thank you Amazon for the wonderful offer!

Reviews.Title: The Dell Venue 7 16 GB Tablet
Reviews.Author: erma l.johnson
Reviews.Content: I like My Venue 7 very much; I purchase this tablet to use away from home, so I would not have to carry my laptop with me and its great in so many ways, communication, searching, directions, games, shopping, and much more, I am still learning how to use it, Would I recommend it to someone else? Yes I would. I am very happy with mine.

Reviews.Title: For the price; best Android deal around!
Reviews.Author: Michael Pepper "Computer Guy"
Reviews.Content: This is not a perfect tablet, and it won't stand up if compared to the Nexus and Samsung machines, but it is a terrific tablet that does, indeed, work very well, with decent battery life, blocks no apps -- having a deliciously vanilla Android 4.2.It is satisfyingly responsive, while still giving a few hours of good run time before needing a charge.  You do need to beware of apps built by inconsiderate programmers with no good sense of battery life -- like "ooVoo" or "Skype". Those guys do drain the battery here very quickly.  (But those apps do that on just about any device they get installed on.There are faster Android tablets out there, and lighter ones too; but this is really a better-than-decent performer -- Waaay better than the one's currently selling between $50 and $100 -- and for only a pittance more.Very easy to recommend for anyone who wants a _good_ 7" Android tablet, but who can't or doesn't want to spend $300 or more.One minor design fault, not a flaw but an issue, is that the power port is on the [long] side, instead of on the [short, top or bottom] end of the tablet.  This is very inconvenient for charging, and if you have a poorly designed case for the Venue 7, then it is even extremely inconvenient.  But, generally, it's just a minor pain.

Reviews.Title: Great Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jesse Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Don't let the brand fool you this is tablet is running AOSP Android with little customizations added on by Dell.  It is running version 4.2.  I bought it for my mom for Christmas and she loves it.  The camera is a no frills camera but get's the job done for video chatting via the Hangouts app.  Overall would recommend it to anyone looking for a solidly built budget android tablet running native Android.

Reviews.Title: exellent tablet
Reviews.Author: William Yepez
Reviews.Content: really good for its price, my wife said "that's a fantastic movil device" and i pleased that she's loved it... exellent gift...

Reviews.Title: exellent
Reviews.Author: rico
Reviews.Content: the tablet is the most faster than others the battery life is awesome and the screen is very hd definition and they send very fast in only 2 days thanks

Reviews.Title: Dell Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: R. Nicotri
Reviews.Content: Many Apps available and many functions to use. It was a gift for my wife and she is pleased with how easy it is to learn how to customize it for herself.

Reviews.Title: Good performance
Reviews.Author: Sally "Sally"
Reviews.Content: The tablet seems to work well for the basic tasks I need it for. Overall I like it, apart from it needing to charge every day, despite the low usage.Iit also takes about two hours to charge fully from a wall socket.It works just like a smartphone, in that I can access the apps through Google Play.It works well with my Wi-Fi.It's slim and fits easily into my purse.It hasn't crashed, although the Scrabble app stopped working twice in the month I've had it and I had to restart.The buttons are easy to access on the sides.The screen quality is excellent - very clear and the brightness is enough at about 35%. Even though the difference between there and 100% isn't drastic, I like to think I'm saving battery power by not needing to have it up full all the time.The camera is good, but definitely not a replacement for the DSLR (not that a tablet should be).The unit is really fast compared to my Asus HD7, which has slowed down in the 4 months of ownership.Wireless signal strength is not a major plus with this product - I am sitting next to my WiFi router that my Asus HD7 can get the full 50mbps down, and in testing with speedtest.net, the Dell Venue 7 keeps getting around 17.95. This isn't critical for most users, but I'd like to think that the very best components were used in anything I buy, and in this situation that doesn't appear to be the case for the WiFi.All in all, it is a lot of tablet for the money, especially considering it is a quality brand like a Dell. Very thankful it hasn't suddenly died, like my ASUS HD7.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!!
Reviews.Author: jdavis4297
Reviews.Content: This tablet is the best bang for your buck you can get, i just got it today but it has not lagged or slowed down and I've been pushing this thing to the Max, the screen is exceptionally good and the intel processor inside this hauls ass. Its only a dual core processor clocked at about 1.6ghz but it also has 2gb of ram which is the averageamount for more high end tablets. I only have 2 complaints. First the stock keyboard...it is horrible, it lagged like crazy and just wasn't an enjoyable experience to type on. But i just downloaded another from the app store and problem solved! Second, this is more than likely just bad luck. But after barely using it for not even 15min the speaker just stopped working for no reason. And Dells customer service has not been helping me out at all. They just keep redirecting me to different offices saying that they can't do anything. But im not going to stop trying. I've been using earbuds for now, but this is a bit of a problem i wish dell wouldn't leave me in the dark about. But like I said, more than likely bad luck on my end, probably just got a defective model

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Ferrell
Reviews.Content: This is a great 7 inch tablet!  For the price, you just can't beat it.  Lots of apps and is super fast.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: C. Sweatt
Reviews.Content: Great Tablet for the money, Dell got it right. Only Con Dell should have added a fullsize USB port for a Aircard.

Reviews.Title: best tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Matt Barton
Reviews.Content: i just received my dell venue 7 and am completely blown away. I bought this on a flash sale from newegg for $99 with free shipping. Sold out in 10 minutes. The tablet is built tough but small enough to take with you anywhere. I would recommend buying a case ASAP. I purchased the universal 7 inch case from rocketfish and it fits perfect, doesnt block anywhere. I also bought the logitech bluetooth keyboard for android.for the price, cant beat it

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Scottie
Reviews.Content: I've been using the Dell Venue of a week or so now & it all works good. I'm new at using a tablet so I can't compare to other models. I ordered a 32GB mini SD card and it recognized it OK. I am pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: dell
Reviews.Author: Fran Scenna
Reviews.Content: The right size ,works great and it"s a Dell ,but for the money it should have come with a case.

Reviews.Title: Very good product. Affordable
Reviews.Author: veoden
Reviews.Content: Very good product. Affordable; Strong performance; Comfortable design; 7-inch HD display with strong overall performance and a low price. alex

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet I love it...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "rrvinion"
Reviews.Content: I love it does everything I need it to do.  Nice sharp picture, games run extremely well on this tablet. All the apps I had on my last tablet loaded quickly on this tablet from the play store.  I love the larger flash drive to my last tablet only had like a 4gb and this one has a 16gb. Very light tablet to easy to hold on to.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: My wife got two of these tablet one for her and one for me we love how easy they are to run and smooth and fast anyone looking for a tablet this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Cameras Not Good
Reviews.Author: R. Gyles
Reviews.Content: I bought this Dell Tablet for my 10 yr old daughter as a gift, I was disappointed at the image quality of the front camera and also the one at the back. Come on Dell we are living in a digital age, phones are being made with 16 megapixel cameras, this is a tablet, a general communication device much more can be done to fit these instruments with better quality cameras for that cost. However, the device is fast and downloads apps and updates really quickly, I have no issues in that regard except the cameras which have no adjustments such as outdoors/indoors, scenery etc. I don't think I'm asking too much for that price.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Tablet  (smaller than iPod mini)
Reviews.Author: FaithLoveGrace
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for such such a little thing.  I have a 7.9 by Acer and purchased this for my boyfriend for his birthday and I must say I was jealous and wanted to trade him.

Reviews.Title: Truly Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Willie Flint
Reviews.Content: I have researched this item thoroughly before purchasing it and was looking forward to receiving it.  I must say that it far exceeds my expectations of it.  My wife has an Ipad that she loves, but is truly impressed with my new Dell Venue 7.  I think that most people who has a true understanding of what they are buying for the price they are paying will find it exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: E. Nickerson
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a great buy and the price was very reasonable.  I would recommend to others as an option to an Apple product.

Reviews.Title: won't play all games
Reviews.Author: Melissa Winters
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite games won't play on it, while it plays on the samsung tablet. it even plays on cell phones.

Reviews.Title: Had to return the defective first one
Reviews.Author: Rowdy "Rowdy"
Reviews.Content: The shipping was prompt from Amazon but this tablet was defective.  I couldn't even log on to my router due to the keyboad being unable to process the number 0 and the letter P.The fact it didn't work right out of the box is not a good sign of quality.****************************** UPDATE ************************************The second Dell fared much better.  The display is not rich but still acceptableno problems connecting over WI-FI and bluetooth.  Apps started quickly.For the price this is a good tablet so I will increase the rating to 3 stars4 stars overall for the Dell but I need to knock it down a star due to having a defectivetablet and needing to return it.Great job by Amazon getting a replacement out to me ASAP

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Juan Z.
Reviews.Content: it does everything I expect it to do and more.  No problems so far.  I would recommend this product.  My wife wants her own now.

Reviews.Title: I'm A Older Fellow, It Works For Me
Reviews.Author: David Earl Moton
Reviews.Content: It Is User Friendly, I Use It Pretty Much Daily. It Is Compatible With A Lots Of Apps Too.I Love It.David Earl

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Allen Eliu Martinez
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, i am happy, this tablet is very light, thin, and have all i needed.  I really recommended.<

Reviews.Title: Quality/price ratio really high
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet, quality/price ratio is great. Took one star because the camera is really not good. Then again, tablet cameras are not that important. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fast shipping! superb tablet, very stylish too (android) my kid love it.Cons: No adobe media player.But would recommend (price wise).

Reviews.Title: This tablet is very fast and cheap
Reviews.Author: Merlin Villalona Abreu
Reviews.Content: I bought it in February and it works very goodI spend a lot of time listening to music,reading books,playing games like asphalt 8,GTA vice city and othersI only can say that I love it.

Reviews.Title: So good we bought a second one.
Reviews.Author: LKS
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for the hubby. He loved it and the teen in the house would steal it when Dad wasn't looking so she could play on it, even though she had a laptop. Her laptop got killed in an unfortunate accident, and she went right out and got one of these. Hubby plays games, teen watches movies/YouTube. Great resolution, fast, and the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: So good we bought a second one.
Reviews.Author: LKS
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for the hubby. He loved it and the teen in the house would steal it when Dad wasn't looking so she could play on it, even though she had a laptop. Her laptop got killed in an unfortunate accident, and she went right out and got one of these. Hubby plays games, teen watches movies/YouTube. Great resolution, fast, and the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT TABLET
Reviews.Author: KALIM GUZMAN
Reviews.Content: VERY FAST PROCESSOR, BEAUTIFUL AND VERY GOOD MANUFATURED PRODUCT, MORE THAN I EXPECTED I RECOMEND IT. GOOD DEFINITION DISPLAY. I SUGGEST IT

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  I bought this for my son for his birthday, he loves it.  I have a Dell Venue 8 so I thought I would try a 7 for my son.  I'll be buying another one later on.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Heather Ringbauer
Reviews.Content: I really liked this tablet. It is easy to use and I have not had any problems. It really works great and have had a lot of fun with it.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: GA Classroom Gift Card
Reviews.Content: Very good tablet, responsive, great screen, light and great feel. Does not have a lot of extra software installed which was important to me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome screen resoultion.
Reviews.Author: ChrisG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for a sister. She set it up and reported that it works great. She uses it for e-mail, Netflix viewing and other multimedia applications.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. It has a clean android platform and it includes an update to 4.3 which works real smooth. It's simply great for everyday basic use with no issues to report.Update 5/15: Dell venue 7 still working well and now has an update to android 4.4!

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: John Viechweg
Reviews.Content: This tablet is definitely worth every penny paid and some extra. The only improvement that can be made would be to the cameras although this is a work tablet thus it does not affect me.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price.
Reviews.Author: ariel l.
Reviews.Content: Very nice...the processor is fast. The only thing i don't like is getting rid of the notifications on the top. I have to click on them one by one to open before i can close them instead of the usual minus sign.

Reviews.Title: dell venue
Reviews.Author: tipoblanco
Reviews.Content: bought the dell venue 7 for my wife at christmas to listen to books on her commute to work,is a very nice tablet,and great process speed

Reviews.Title: Best in class!!!!
Reviews.Author: kristin mccann
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my seventeen year old who killed his laptop and was looking at tablets vs laptops. He can do a lot of what he could on a laptop and more with all of the apps available. He still uses our laptop for word processing but he is really happy with this tablet for surfing the web and playing games and he can take it a lot more places than a laptop. We have several other tablets around the same price range and this one is by far the best in its class. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Everything it said it was
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Walker
Reviews.Content: I replaced a chromebook with this little tablet, and I love it I can chromecast with it to my TV and can watch a couple netflix movies on one charge.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Gaia2Joe
